result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon C Lara

records.addlTxt: Per SCR 72, documents have been optically imaged and file destroyed.

Defendant Brandon C Lara in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

On motioin of the State, Court orders Count 3 DISMISSED and read-in for sentencing purposes.

Defendant Brandon C Lara in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Jesica Ballenger for Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds
  Plea hearing scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brandon C Lara in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense has received discovery and State will convey an offer to the defense.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with APV (10/18/99) OR HER FAMILY.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Brandon C Lara in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Defendant Brandon C Lara in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Branch 44 for scheduling conference.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
